conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the graph to determine when the particle is farthest from its starting point by examining the peaks.
The image shows a graph of acceleration versus time with two triangular sections: first triangle from t=0 to t=t0/2 with acceleration a0, second triangle from t=t0/2 to t=2t0 with acceleration -3a0.
The particle's position is determined by integrating its acceleration over time.
Identify the peaks: first peak at t=t0/2 with acceleration a0.
Calculate the displacement at the first peak by integrating acceleration from t=0 to t=t0/2.
Compare with the second peak at t=2t0 with acceleration -3a0 and calculate the displacement.
Determine the farthest point by comparing the two displacements.
Displacement at t=2t0 is greater than at t=t0/2, so the particle is farthest from the starting point at t=2t0.
